# Wave scope
The wave scope is a simple oscilloscope-type waveform display.

![](https://flux-shared.s3.amazonaws.com/doc_images/Analyzer/Wavescope/Main2.png)

![](https://flux-shared.s3.amazonaws.com/doc_images/Analyzer/Wavescope/Main3.png)

![](https://flux-shared.s3.amazonaws.com/doc_images/Analyzer/Wavescope/Main1.png)

Wave scope display with stereo input.

:::{.callout-note}
The wave scope will include more functionality and settings in future releases.
:::

<!-- ALLVERSION-->

## Setup
![](https://flux-shared.s3.amazonaws.com/doc_images/Analyzer/Wavescope/Setup.png)

### Time
Time window in milliseconds.

### Color Mode

![](https://flux-shared.s3.amazonaws.com/doc_images/Analyzer/Wavescope/ColorModes.png)

#### Static
Displays the waves using 1 unique static color.

#### Custom Dynamic
Displays the waves according to the transient using a 2 user defined colors gradient.

>If custom dynamic chosen, user defined Color 1 and Color 2 will be used>


#### Rainbow Dynamic
Displays the waves according to the transient using a rainbow colors gradient.
